00064 static void ll_ra_stats_inc_sbi(struct ll_sb_info *sbi, enum ra_stat which);
00065 
00085 static unsigned long ll_ra_count_get(struct ll_sb_info *sbi,
00086                                      struct ra_io_arg *ria,
00087                                      unsigned long pages, unsigned long min)
00088 {
00089         struct ll_ra_info *ra = &sbi->ll_ra_info;
00090         long ret;
00091         ENTRY;
00092 
00093         /* If read-ahead pages left are less than 1M, do not do read-ahead,
00094          * otherwise it will form small read RPC(< 1M), which hurt server
00095          * performance a lot. */
00096         ret = min(ra->ra_max_pages - atomic_read(&ra->ra_cur_pages),
00097                   pages);
00098         if (ret < 0 || ret < min_t(long, PTLRPC_MAX_BRW_PAGES, pages))
00099                 GOTO(out, ret = 0);
00100 
00101         if (atomic_add_return(ret, &ra->ra_cur_pages) > ra->ra_max_pages) {
00102                 atomic_sub(ret, &ra->ra_cur_pages);
00103                 ret = 0;
00104         }
00105 
00106 out:
00107         if (ret < min) {
00108                 /* override ra limit for maximum performance */
00109                 atomic_add(min - ret, &ra->ra_cur_pages);
00110                 ret = min;
00111         }
00112         RETURN(ret);
00113 }
00114 
00115 void ll_ra_count_put(struct ll_sb_info *sbi, unsigned long len)
00116 {
00117         struct ll_ra_info *ra = &sbi->ll_ra_info;
00118         atomic_sub(len, &ra->ra_cur_pages);
00119 }
00120 
00121 static void ll_ra_stats_inc_sbi(struct ll_sb_info *sbi, enum ra_stat which)
00122 {
00123         LASSERTF(which >= 0 && which < _NR_RA_STAT, "which: %u\n", which);
00124         lprocfs_counter_incr(sbi->ll_ra_stats, which);
00125 }
00126 
00127 void ll_ra_stats_inc(struct inode *inode, enum ra_stat which)
00128 {
00129         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_i2sbi(inode);
00130         ll_ra_stats_inc_sbi(sbi, which);
00131 }

00133 #define RAS_CDEBUG(ras) \
00134         CDEBUG(D_READA,                                                      \
00135                "lrp %lu cr %lu cp %lu ws %lu wl %lu nra %lu rpc %lu "        \
00136                "r %lu ri %lu csr %lu sf %lu sp %lu sl %lu\n",                \
00137                ras->ras_last_readpage, ras->ras_consecutive_requests,        \
00138                ras->ras_consecutive_pages, ras->ras_window_start,            \
00139                ras->ras_window_len, ras->ras_next_readahead,                 \
00140                ras->ras_rpc_size,                                            \
00141                ras->ras_requests, ras->ras_request_index,                    \
00142                ras->ras_consecutive_stride_requests, ras->ras_stride_offset, \
00143                ras->ras_stride_pages, ras->ras_stride_length)
00144 
00145 static int index_in_window(unsigned long index, unsigned long point,
00146                            unsigned long before, unsigned long after)
00147 {
00148         unsigned long start = point - before, end = point + after;
00149 
00150         if (start > point)
00151                start = 0;
00152         if (end < point)
00153                end = ~0;
00154 
00155         return start <= index && index <= end;
00156 }
00157 
00158 void ll_ras_enter(struct file *f)
00159 {
00160         struct ll_file_data *fd = LUSTRE_FPRIVATE(f);
00161         struct ll_readahead_state *ras = &fd->fd_ras;
00162 
00163         spin_lock(&ras->ras_lock);
00164         ras->ras_requests++;
00165         ras->ras_request_index = 0;
00166         ras->ras_consecutive_requests++;
00167         spin_unlock(&ras->ras_lock);
00168 }
00169 
00178 static int ll_read_ahead_page(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_io *io,
00179                               struct cl_page_list *queue, pgoff_t index)
00180 {
00181         struct cl_object *clob  = io->ci_obj;
00182         struct inode     *inode = vvp_object_inode(clob);
00183         struct page      *vmpage;
00184         struct cl_page   *page;
00185         struct vvp_page  *vpg;
00186         enum ra_stat      which = _NR_RA_STAT; /* keep gcc happy */
00187         int               rc    = 0;
00188         const char       *msg   = NULL;
00189         ENTRY;
00190 
00191         vmpage = grab_cache_page_nowait(inode->i_mapping, index);
00192         if (vmpage == NULL) {
00193                 which = RA_STAT_FAILED_GRAB_PAGE;
00194                 msg   = "g_c_p_n failed";
00195                 GOTO(out, rc = -EBUSY);
00196         }
00197 
00198         /* Check if vmpage was truncated or reclaimed */
00199         if (vmpage->mapping != inode->i_mapping) {
00200                 which = RA_STAT_WRONG_GRAB_PAGE;
00201                 msg   = "g_c_p_n returned invalid page";
00202                 GOTO(out, rc = -EBUSY);
00203         }
00204 
00205         page = cl_page_find(env, clob, vmpage->index, vmpage, CPT_CACHEABLE);
00206         if (IS_ERR(page)) {
00207                 which = RA_STAT_FAILED_GRAB_PAGE;
00208                 msg   = "cl_page_find failed";
00209                 GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(page));
00210         }
00211 
00212         lu_ref_add(&page->cp_reference, "ra", current);
00213         cl_page_assume(env, io, page);
00214         vpg = cl2vvp_page(cl_object_page_slice(clob, page));
00215         if (!vpg->vpg_defer_uptodate && !PageUptodate(vmpage)) {
00216                 vpg->vpg_defer_uptodate = 1;
00217                 vpg->vpg_ra_used = 0;
00218                 cl_page_list_add(queue, page);
00219         } else {
00220                 /* skip completed pages */
00221                 cl_page_unassume(env, io, page);
00222                 /* This page is already uptodate, returning a positive number
00223                  * to tell the callers about this */
00224                 rc = 1;
00225         }
00226 
00227         lu_ref_del(&page->cp_reference, "ra", current);
00228         cl_page_put(env, page);
00229 
00230 out:
00231         if (vmpage != NULL) {
00232                 if (rc != 0)
00233                         unlock_page(vmpage);
00234                 page_cache_release(vmpage);
00235         }
00236         if (msg != NULL) {
00237                 ll_ra_stats_inc(inode, which);
00238                 CDEBUG(D_READA, "%s\n", msg);
00239 
00240         }
00241 
00242         RETURN(rc);
00243 }
00244 
00245 #define RIA_DEBUG(ria)                                                       \
00246         CDEBUG(D_READA, "rs %lu re %lu ro %lu rl %lu rp %lu\n",       \
00247         ria->ria_start, ria->ria_end, ria->ria_stoff, ria->ria_length,\
00248         ria->ria_pages)
00249 
00250 static inline int stride_io_mode(struct ll_readahead_state *ras)
00251 {
00252         return ras->ras_consecutive_stride_requests > 1;
00253 }
00254 
00255 /* The function calculates how much pages will be read in
00256  * [off, off + length], in such stride IO area,
00257  * stride_offset = st_off, stride_lengh = st_len,
00258  * stride_pages = st_pgs
00259  *
00260  *   |------------------|*****|------------------|*****|------------|*****|....
00261  * st_off
00262  *   |--- st_pgs     ---|
00263  *   |-----     st_len   -----|
00264  *
00265  *              How many pages it should read in such pattern
00266  *              |-------------------------------------------------------------|
00267  *              off
00268  *              |<------                  length                      ------->|
00269  *
00270  *          =   |<----->|  +  |-------------------------------------| +   |---|
00271  *             start_left                 st_pgs * i                    end_left
00272  */
00273 static unsigned long
00274 stride_pg_count(pgoff_t st_off, unsigned long st_len, unsigned long st_pgs,
00275                 unsigned long off, unsigned long length)
00276 {
00277         __u64 start = off > st_off ? off - st_off : 0;
00278         __u64 end = off + length > st_off ? off + length - st_off : 0;
00279         unsigned long start_left = 0;
00280         unsigned long end_left = 0;
00281         unsigned long pg_count;
00282 
00283         if (st_len == 0 || length == 0 || end == 0)
00284                 return length;
00285 
00286         start_left = do_div(start, st_len);
00287         if (start_left < st_pgs)
00288                 start_left = st_pgs - start_left;
00289         else
00290                 start_left = 0;
00291 
00292         end_left = do_div(end, st_len);
00293         if (end_left > st_pgs)
00294                 end_left = st_pgs;
00295 
00296         CDEBUG(D_READA, "start "LPU64", end "LPU64" start_left %lu end_left %lu \n",
00297                start, end, start_left, end_left);
00298 
00299         if (start == end)
00300                 pg_count = end_left - (st_pgs - start_left);
00301         else
00302                 pg_count = start_left + st_pgs * (end - start - 1) + end_left;
00303 
00304         CDEBUG(D_READA, "st_off %lu, st_len %lu st_pgs %lu off %lu length %lu"
00305                "pgcount %lu\n", st_off, st_len, st_pgs, off, length, pg_count);
00306 
00307         return pg_count;
00308 }
00309 
00310 static int ria_page_count(struct ra_io_arg *ria)
00311 {
00312         __u64 length = ria->ria_end >= ria->ria_start ?
00313                        ria->ria_end - ria->ria_start + 1 : 0;
00314 
00315         return stride_pg_count(ria->ria_stoff, ria->ria_length,
00316                                ria->ria_pages, ria->ria_start,
00317                                length);
00318 }
00319 
00320 static unsigned long ras_align(struct ll_readahead_state *ras,
00321                                unsigned long index,
00322                                unsigned long *remainder)
00323 {
00324         unsigned long rem = index % ras->ras_rpc_size;
00325         if (remainder != NULL)
00326                 *remainder = rem;
00327         return index - rem;
00328 }
00329 
00330 /*Check whether the index is in the defined ra-window */
00331 static int ras_inside_ra_window(unsigned long idx, struct ra_io_arg *ria)
00332 {
00333         /* If ria_length == ria_pages, it means non-stride I/O mode,
00334          * idx should always inside read-ahead window in this case
00335          * For stride I/O mode, just check whether the idx is inside
00336          * the ria_pages. */
00337         return ria->ria_length == 0 || ria->ria_length == ria->ria_pages ||
00338                (idx >= ria->ria_stoff && (idx - ria->ria_stoff) %
00339                 ria->ria_length < ria->ria_pages);
00340 }
00341 
00342 static unsigned long
00343 ll_read_ahead_pages(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_io *io,
00344                     struct cl_page_list *queue, struct ll_readahead_state *ras,
00345                     struct ra_io_arg *ria)
00346 {
00347         struct cl_read_ahead ra = { 0 };
00348         int rc = 0;
00349         bool stride_ria;
00350         unsigned long ra_end = 0;
00351         pgoff_t page_idx;
00352 
00353         LASSERT(ria != NULL);
00354         RIA_DEBUG(ria);
00355 
00356         stride_ria = ria->ria_length > ria->ria_pages && ria->ria_pages > 0;
00357         for (page_idx = ria->ria_start;
00358              page_idx <= ria->ria_end && ria->ria_reserved > 0; page_idx++) {
00359                 if (ras_inside_ra_window(page_idx, ria)) {
00360                         if (ra.cra_end == 0 || ra.cra_end < page_idx) {
00361                                 unsigned long end;
00362 
00363                                 cl_read_ahead_release(env, &ra);
00364 
00365                                 rc = cl_io_read_ahead(env, io, page_idx, &ra);
00366                                 if (rc < 0)
00367                                         break;
00368 
00369                                 CDEBUG(D_READA, "idx: %lu, ra: %lu, rpc: %lu\n",
00370                                        page_idx, ra.cra_end, ra.cra_rpc_size);
00371                                 LASSERTF(ra.cra_end >= page_idx,
00372                                          "object: %p, indcies %lu / %lu\n",
00373                                          io->ci_obj, ra.cra_end, page_idx);
00374                                 /* update read ahead RPC size.
00375                                  * NB: it's racy but doesn't matter */
00376                                 if (ras->ras_rpc_size > ra.cra_rpc_size &&
00377                                     ra.cra_rpc_size > 0)
00378                                         ras->ras_rpc_size = ra.cra_rpc_size;
00379                                 /* trim it to align with optimal RPC size */
00380                                 end = ras_align(ras, ria->ria_end + 1, NULL);
00381                                 if (end > 0 && !ria->ria_eof)
00382                                         ria->ria_end = end - 1;
00383                                 if (ria->ria_end < ria->ria_end_min)
00384                                         ria->ria_end = ria->ria_end_min;
00385                                 if (ria->ria_end > ra.cra_end)
00386                                         ria->ria_end = ra.cra_end;
00387                         }
00388                         if (page_idx > ria->ria_end)
00389                                 break;
00390 
00391                         /* If the page is inside the read-ahead window */
00392                         rc = ll_read_ahead_page(env, io, queue, page_idx);
00393                         if (rc < 0)
00394                                 break;
00395 
00396                         ra_end = page_idx;
00397                         if (rc == 0)
00398                                 ria->ria_reserved--;
00399                 } else if (stride_ria) {
00400                         /* If it is not in the read-ahead window, and it is
00401                          * read-ahead mode, then check whether it should skip
00402                          * the stride gap */
00403                         pgoff_t offset;
00404                         /* FIXME: This assertion only is valid when it is for
00405                          * forward read-ahead, it will be fixed when backward
00406                          * read-ahead is implemented */
00407                         LASSERTF(page_idx >= ria->ria_stoff,
00408                                 "Invalid page_idx %lu rs %lu re %lu ro %lu "
00409                                 "rl %lu rp %lu\n", page_idx,
00410                                 ria->ria_start, ria->ria_end, ria->ria_stoff,
00411                                 ria->ria_length, ria->ria_pages);
00412                         offset = page_idx - ria->ria_stoff;
00413                         offset = offset % (ria->ria_length);
00414                         if (offset > ria->ria_pages) {
00415                                 page_idx += ria->ria_length - offset;
00416                                 CDEBUG(D_READA, "i %lu skip %lu \n", page_idx,
00417                                        ria->ria_length - offset);
00418                                 continue;
00419                         }
00420                 }
00421         }
00422 
00423         cl_read_ahead_release(env, &ra);
00424 
00425         return ra_end;
00426 }
00427 
00428 static int ll_readahead(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_io *io,
00429                         struct cl_page_list *queue,
00430                         struct ll_readahead_state *ras, bool hit)
00431 {
00432         struct vvp_io *vio = vvp_env_io(env);
00433         struct ll_thread_info *lti = ll_env_info(env);
00434         struct cl_attr *attr = vvp_env_thread_attr(env);
00435         unsigned long len, mlen = 0;
00436         pgoff_t ra_end, start = 0, end = 0;
00437         struct inode *inode;
00438         struct ra_io_arg *ria = &lti->lti_ria;
00439         struct cl_object *clob;
00440         int ret = 0;
00441         __u64 kms;
00442         ENTRY;
00443 
00444         clob = io->ci_obj;
00445         inode = vvp_object_inode(clob);
00446 
00447         memset(ria, 0, sizeof *ria);
00448 
00449         cl_object_attr_lock(clob);
00450         ret = cl_object_attr_get(env, clob, attr);
00451         cl_object_attr_unlock(clob);
00452 
00453         if (ret != 0)
00454                 RETURN(ret);
00455         kms = attr->cat_kms;
00456         if (kms == 0) {
00457                 ll_ra_stats_inc(inode, RA_STAT_ZERO_LEN);
00458                 RETURN(0);
00459         }
00460 
00461         spin_lock(&ras->ras_lock);
00462 
00470         if (stride_io_mode(ras))
00471                 start = max(ras->ras_next_readahead, ras->ras_stride_offset);
00472         else
00473                 start = ras->ras_next_readahead;
00474 
00475         if (ras->ras_window_len > 0)
00476                 end = ras->ras_window_start + ras->ras_window_len - 1;
00477 
00478         /* Enlarge the RA window to encompass the full read */
00479         if (vio->vui_ra_valid &&
00480             end < vio->vui_ra_start + vio->vui_ra_count - 1)
00481                 end = vio->vui_ra_start + vio->vui_ra_count - 1;
00482 
00483         if (end != 0) {
00484                 unsigned long end_index;
00485 
00486                 /* Truncate RA window to end of file */
00487                 end_index = (unsigned long)((kms - 1) >> PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT);
00488                 if (end_index <= end) {
00489                         end = end_index;
00490                         ria->ria_eof = true;
00491                 }
00492 
00493                 ras->ras_next_readahead = max(end, end + 1);
00494                 RAS_CDEBUG(ras);
00495         }
00496         ria->ria_start = start;
00497         ria->ria_end = end;
00498         /* If stride I/O mode is detected, get stride window*/
00499         if (stride_io_mode(ras)) {
00500                 ria->ria_stoff = ras->ras_stride_offset;
00501                 ria->ria_length = ras->ras_stride_length;
00502                 ria->ria_pages = ras->ras_stride_pages;
00503         }
00504         spin_unlock(&ras->ras_lock);
00505 
00506         if (end == 0) {
00507                 ll_ra_stats_inc(inode, RA_STAT_ZERO_WINDOW);
00508                 RETURN(0);
00509         }
00510         len = ria_page_count(ria);
00511         if (len == 0) {
00512                 ll_ra_stats_inc(inode, RA_STAT_ZERO_WINDOW);
00513                 RETURN(0);
00514         }
00515 
00516         CDEBUG(D_READA, DFID": ria: %lu/%lu, bead: %lu/%lu, hit: %d\n",
00517                PFID(lu_object_fid(&clob->co_lu)),
00518                ria->ria_start, ria->ria_end,
00519                vio->vui_ra_valid ? vio->vui_ra_start : 0,
00520                vio->vui_ra_valid ? vio->vui_ra_count : 0,
00521                hit);
00522 
00523         /* at least to extend the readahead window to cover current read */
00524         if (!hit && vio->vui_ra_valid &&
00525             vio->vui_ra_start + vio->vui_ra_count > ria->ria_start) {
00526                 unsigned long remainder;
00527 
00528                 /* to the end of current read window. */
00529                 mlen = vio->vui_ra_start + vio->vui_ra_count - ria->ria_start;
00530                 /* trim to RPC boundary */
00531                 ras_align(ras, ria->ria_start, &remainder);
00532                 mlen = min(mlen, ras->ras_rpc_size - remainder);
00533                 ria->ria_end_min = ria->ria_start + mlen;
00534         }
00535 
00536         ria->ria_reserved = ll_ra_count_get(ll_i2sbi(inode), ria, len, mlen);
00537         if (ria->ria_reserved < len)
00538                 ll_ra_stats_inc(inode, RA_STAT_MAX_IN_FLIGHT);
00539 
00540         CDEBUG(D_READA, "reserved pages: %lu/%lu/%lu, ra_cur %d, ra_max %lu\n",
00541                ria->ria_reserved, len, mlen,
00542                atomic_read(&ll_i2sbi(inode)->ll_ra_info.ra_cur_pages),
00543                ll_i2sbi(inode)->ll_ra_info.ra_max_pages);
00544 
00545         ra_end = ll_read_ahead_pages(env, io, queue, ras, ria);
00546 
00547         if (ria->ria_reserved != 0)
00548                 ll_ra_count_put(ll_i2sbi(inode), ria->ria_reserved);
00549 
00550         if (ra_end == end && ra_end == (kms >> PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT))
00551                 ll_ra_stats_inc(inode, RA_STAT_EOF);
00552 
00553         /* if we didn't get to the end of the region we reserved from
00554          * the ras we need to go back and update the ras so that the
00555          * next read-ahead tries from where we left off.  we only do so
00556          * if the region we failed to issue read-ahead on is still ahead
00557          * of the app and behind the next index to start read-ahead from */
00558         CDEBUG(D_READA, "ra_end = %lu end = %lu stride end = %lu pages = %d\n",
00559                ra_end, end, ria->ria_end, ret);
00560 
00561         if (ra_end > 0 && ra_end != end) {
00562                 ll_ra_stats_inc(inode, RA_STAT_FAILED_REACH_END);
00563                 spin_lock(&ras->ras_lock);
00564                 if (ra_end <= ras->ras_next_readahead &&
00565                     index_in_window(ra_end, ras->ras_window_start, 0,
00566                                     ras->ras_window_len)) {
00567                         ras->ras_next_readahead = ra_end + 1;
00568                         RAS_CDEBUG(ras);
00569                 }
00570                 spin_unlock(&ras->ras_lock);
00571         }
00572 
00573         RETURN(ret);
00574 }
00575 
00576 static void ras_set_start(struct inode *inode, struct ll_readahead_state *ras,
00577                           unsigned long index)
00578 {
00579         ras->ras_window_start = ras_align(ras, index, NULL);
00580 }
00581 
00582 /* called with the ras_lock held or from places where it doesn't matter */
00583 static void ras_reset(struct inode *inode, struct ll_readahead_state *ras,
00584                       unsigned long index)
00585 {
00586         ras->ras_last_readpage = index;
00587         ras->ras_consecutive_requests = 0;
00588         ras->ras_consecutive_pages = 0;
00589         ras->ras_window_len = 0;
00590         ras_set_start(inode, ras, index);
00591         ras->ras_next_readahead = max(ras->ras_window_start, index + 1);
00592 
00593         RAS_CDEBUG(ras);
00594 }
00595 
00596 /* called with the ras_lock held or from places where it doesn't matter */
00597 static void ras_stride_reset(struct ll_readahead_state *ras)
00598 {
00599         ras->ras_consecutive_stride_requests = 0;
00600         ras->ras_stride_length = 0;
00601         ras->ras_stride_pages = 0;
00602         RAS_CDEBUG(ras);
00603 }
00604 
00605 void ll_readahead_init(struct inode *inode, struct ll_readahead_state *ras)
00606 {
00607         spin_lock_init(&ras->ras_lock);
00608         ras->ras_rpc_size = PTLRPC_MAX_BRW_PAGES;
00609         ras_reset(inode, ras, 0);
00610         ras->ras_requests = 0;
00611 }
00612 
00613 /*
00614  * Check whether the read request is in the stride window.
00615  * If it is in the stride window, return 1, otherwise return 0.
00616  */
00617 static int index_in_stride_window(struct ll_readahead_state *ras,
00618                                   unsigned long index)
00619 {
00620         unsigned long stride_gap;
00621 
00622         if (ras->ras_stride_length == 0 || ras->ras_stride_pages == 0 ||
00623             ras->ras_stride_pages == ras->ras_stride_length)
00624                 return 0;
00625 
00626         stride_gap = index - ras->ras_last_readpage - 1;
00627 
00628         /* If it is contiguous read */
00629         if (stride_gap == 0)
00630                 return ras->ras_consecutive_pages + 1 <= ras->ras_stride_pages;
00631 
00632         /* Otherwise check the stride by itself */
00633         return (ras->ras_stride_length - ras->ras_stride_pages) == stride_gap &&
00634                 ras->ras_consecutive_pages == ras->ras_stride_pages;
00635 }
00636 
00637 static void ras_update_stride_detector(struct ll_readahead_state *ras,
00638                                        unsigned long index)
00639 {
00640         unsigned long stride_gap = index - ras->ras_last_readpage - 1;
00641 
00642         if (!stride_io_mode(ras) && (stride_gap != 0 ||
00643              ras->ras_consecutive_stride_requests == 0)) {
00644                 ras->ras_stride_pages = ras->ras_consecutive_pages;
00645                 ras->ras_stride_length = stride_gap +ras->ras_consecutive_pages;
00646         }
00647         LASSERT(ras->ras_request_index == 0);
00648         LASSERT(ras->ras_consecutive_stride_requests == 0);
00649 
00650         if (index <= ras->ras_last_readpage) {
00651                 /*Reset stride window for forward read*/
00652                 ras_stride_reset(ras);
00653                 return;
00654         }
00655 
00656         ras->ras_stride_pages = ras->ras_consecutive_pages;
00657         ras->ras_stride_length = stride_gap +ras->ras_consecutive_pages;
00658 
00659         RAS_CDEBUG(ras);
00660         return;
00661 }
00662 
00663 static unsigned long
00664 stride_page_count(struct ll_readahead_state *ras, unsigned long len)
00665 {
00666         return stride_pg_count(ras->ras_stride_offset, ras->ras_stride_length,
00667                                ras->ras_stride_pages, ras->ras_stride_offset,
00668                                len);
00669 }
00670 
00671 /* Stride Read-ahead window will be increased inc_len according to
00672  * stride I/O pattern */
00673 static void ras_stride_increase_window(struct ll_readahead_state *ras,
00674                                        struct ll_ra_info *ra,
00675                                        unsigned long inc_len)
00676 {
00677         unsigned long left, step, window_len;
00678         unsigned long stride_len;
00679 
00680         LASSERT(ras->ras_stride_length > 0);
00681         LASSERTF(ras->ras_window_start + ras->ras_window_len
00682                  >= ras->ras_stride_offset, "window_start %lu, window_len %lu"
00683                  " stride_offset %lu\n", ras->ras_window_start,
00684                  ras->ras_window_len, ras->ras_stride_offset);
00685 
00686         stride_len = ras->ras_window_start + ras->ras_window_len -
00687                      ras->ras_stride_offset;
00688 
00689         left = stride_len % ras->ras_stride_length;
00690         window_len = ras->ras_window_len - left;
00691 
00692         if (left < ras->ras_stride_pages)
00693                 left += inc_len;
00694         else
00695                 left = ras->ras_stride_pages + inc_len;
00696 
00697         LASSERT(ras->ras_stride_pages != 0);
00698 
00699         step = left / ras->ras_stride_pages;
00700         left %= ras->ras_stride_pages;
00701 
00702         window_len += step * ras->ras_stride_length + left;
00703 
00704         if (stride_page_count(ras, window_len) <= ra->ra_max_pages_per_file)
00705                 ras->ras_window_len = window_len;
00706 
00707         RAS_CDEBUG(ras);
00708 }
00709 
00710 static void ras_increase_window(struct inode *inode,
00711                                 struct ll_readahead_state *ras,
00712                                 struct ll_ra_info *ra)
00713 {
00714         /* The stretch of ra-window should be aligned with max rpc_size
00715          * but current clio architecture does not support retrieve such
00716          * information from lower layer. FIXME later
00717          */
00718         if (stride_io_mode(ras)) {
00719                 ras_stride_increase_window(ras, ra, ras->ras_rpc_size);
00720         } else {
00721                 unsigned long wlen;
00722 
00723                 wlen = min(ras->ras_window_len + ras->ras_rpc_size,
00724                            ra->ra_max_pages_per_file);
00725                 ras->ras_window_len = ras_align(ras, wlen, NULL);
00726         }
00727 }
00728 
00729 static void ras_update(struct ll_sb_info *sbi, struct inode *inode,
00730                        struct ll_readahead_state *ras, unsigned long index,
00731                        enum ras_update_flags flags)
00732 {
00733         struct ll_ra_info *ra = &sbi->ll_ra_info;
00734         bool hit = flags & LL_RAS_HIT;
00735         int zero = 0, stride_detect = 0, ra_miss = 0;
00736         ENTRY;
00737 
00738         spin_lock(&ras->ras_lock);
00739 
00740         ll_ra_stats_inc_sbi(sbi, hit ? RA_STAT_HIT : RA_STAT_MISS);
00741 
00742         /* reset the read-ahead window in two cases.  First when the app seeks
00743          * or reads to some other part of the file.  Secondly if we get a
00744          * read-ahead miss that we think we've previously issued.  This can
00745          * be a symptom of there being so many read-ahead pages that the VM is
00746          * reclaiming it before we get to it. */
00747         if (!index_in_window(index, ras->ras_last_readpage, 8, 8)) {
00748                 zero = 1;
00749                 ll_ra_stats_inc_sbi(sbi, RA_STAT_DISTANT_READPAGE);
00750         } else if (!hit && ras->ras_window_len &&
00751                    index < ras->ras_next_readahead &&
00752                    index_in_window(index, ras->ras_window_start, 0,
00753                                    ras->ras_window_len)) {
00754                 ra_miss = 1;
00755                 ll_ra_stats_inc_sbi(sbi, RA_STAT_MISS_IN_WINDOW);
00756         }
00757 
00758         /* On the second access to a file smaller than the tunable
00759          * ra_max_read_ahead_whole_pages trigger RA on all pages in the
00760          * file up to ra_max_pages_per_file.  This is simply a best effort
00761          * and only occurs once per open file.  Normal RA behavior is reverted
00762          * to for subsequent IO.  The mmap case does not increment
00763          * ras_requests and thus can never trigger this behavior. */
00764         if (ras->ras_requests >= 2 && !ras->ras_request_index) {
00765                 __u64 kms_pages;
00766 
00767                 kms_pages = (i_size_read(inode) + PAGE_CACHE_SIZE - 1) >>
00768                             PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
00769 
00770                 CDEBUG(D_READA, "kmsp "LPU64" mwp %lu mp %lu\n", kms_pages,
00771                        ra->ra_max_read_ahead_whole_pages, ra->ra_max_pages_per_file);
00772 
00773                 if (kms_pages &&
00774                     kms_pages <= ra->ra_max_read_ahead_whole_pages) {
00775                         ras->ras_window_start = 0;
00776                         ras->ras_next_readahead = index + 1;
00777                         ras->ras_window_len = min(ra->ra_max_pages_per_file,
00778                                 ra->ra_max_read_ahead_whole_pages);
00779                         GOTO(out_unlock, 0);
00780                 }
00781         }
00782         if (zero) {
00783                 /* check whether it is in stride I/O mode*/
00784                 if (!index_in_stride_window(ras, index)) {
00785                         if (ras->ras_consecutive_stride_requests == 0 &&
00786                             ras->ras_request_index == 0) {
00787                                 ras_update_stride_detector(ras, index);
00788                                 ras->ras_consecutive_stride_requests++;
00789                         } else {
00790                                 ras_stride_reset(ras);
00791                         }
00792                         ras_reset(inode, ras, index);
00793                         ras->ras_consecutive_pages++;
00794                         GOTO(out_unlock, 0);
00795                 } else {
00796                         ras->ras_consecutive_pages = 0;
00797                         ras->ras_consecutive_requests = 0;
00798                         if (++ras->ras_consecutive_stride_requests > 1)
00799                                 stride_detect = 1;
00800                         RAS_CDEBUG(ras);
00801                 }
00802         } else {
00803                 if (ra_miss) {
00804                         if (index_in_stride_window(ras, index) &&
00805                             stride_io_mode(ras)) {
00806                                 /*If stride-RA hit cache miss, the stride dector
00807                                  *will not be reset to avoid the overhead of
00808                                  *redetecting read-ahead mode */
00809                                 if (index != ras->ras_last_readpage + 1)
00810                                         ras->ras_consecutive_pages = 0;
00811                                 ras_reset(inode, ras, index);
00812                                 RAS_CDEBUG(ras);
00813                         } else {
00814                                 /* Reset both stride window and normal RA
00815                                  * window */
00816                                 ras_reset(inode, ras, index);
00817                                 ras->ras_consecutive_pages++;
00818                                 ras_stride_reset(ras);
00819                                 GOTO(out_unlock, 0);
00820                         }
00821                 } else if (stride_io_mode(ras)) {
00822                         /* If this is contiguous read but in stride I/O mode
00823                          * currently, check whether stride step still is valid,
00824                          * if invalid, it will reset the stride ra window*/
00825                         if (!index_in_stride_window(ras, index)) {
00826                                 /* Shrink stride read-ahead window to be zero */
00827                                 ras_stride_reset(ras);
00828                                 ras->ras_window_len = 0;
00829                                 ras->ras_next_readahead = index;
00830                         }
00831                 }
00832         }
00833         ras->ras_consecutive_pages++;
00834         ras->ras_last_readpage = index;
00835         ras_set_start(inode, ras, index);
00836 
00837         if (stride_io_mode(ras)) {
00838                 /* Since stride readahead is sentivite to the offset
00839                  * of read-ahead, so we use original offset here,
00840                  * instead of ras_window_start, which is RPC aligned */
00841                 ras->ras_next_readahead = max(index, ras->ras_next_readahead);
00842                 ras->ras_window_start = max(ras->ras_stride_offset,
00843                                             ras->ras_window_start);
00844         } else {
00845                 if (ras->ras_next_readahead < ras->ras_window_start)
00846                         ras->ras_next_readahead = ras->ras_window_start;
00847                 if (!hit)
00848                         ras->ras_next_readahead = index + 1;
00849         }
00850         RAS_CDEBUG(ras);
00851 
00852         /* Trigger RA in the mmap case where ras_consecutive_requests
00853          * is not incremented and thus can't be used to trigger RA */
00854         if (ras->ras_consecutive_pages >= 4 && flags & LL_RAS_MMAP) {
00855                 ras_increase_window(inode, ras, ra);
00856                 /* reset consecutive pages so that the readahead window can
00857                  * grow gradually. */
00858                 ras->ras_consecutive_pages = 0;
00859                 GOTO(out_unlock, 0);
00860         }
00861 
00862         /* Initially reset the stride window offset to next_readahead*/
00863         if (ras->ras_consecutive_stride_requests == 2 && stride_detect) {
00868                 ras->ras_next_readahead = max(index, ras->ras_next_readahead);
00869                 ras->ras_stride_offset = index;
00870                 ras->ras_window_start = max(index, ras->ras_window_start);
00871         }
00872 
00873         /* The initial ras_window_len is set to the request size.  To avoid
00874          * uselessly reading and discarding pages for random IO the window is
00875          * only increased once per consecutive request received. */
00876         if ((ras->ras_consecutive_requests > 1 || stride_detect) &&
00877             !ras->ras_request_index)
00878                 ras_increase_window(inode, ras, ra);
00879         EXIT;
00880 out_unlock:
00881         RAS_CDEBUG(ras);
00882         ras->ras_request_index++;
00883         spin_unlock(&ras->ras_lock);
00884         return;
00885 }
00886 
00887 int ll_writepage(struct page *vmpage, struct writeback_control *wbc)
00888 {
00889         struct inode           *inode = vmpage->mapping->host;
00890         struct ll_inode_info   *lli   = ll_i2info(inode);
00891         struct lu_env          *env;
00892         struct cl_io           *io;
00893         struct cl_page         *page;
00894         struct cl_object       *clob;
00895         struct cl_env_nest      nest;
00896         bool redirtied = false;
00897         bool unlocked = false;
00898         int result;
00899         ENTRY;
00900 
00901         LASSERT(PageLocked(vmpage));
00902         LASSERT(!PageWriteback(vmpage));
00903 
00904         LASSERT(ll_i2dtexp(inode) != NULL);
00905 
00906         env = cl_env_nested_get(&nest);
00907         if (IS_ERR(env))
00908                 GOTO(out, result = PTR_ERR(env));
00909 
00910         clob  = ll_i2info(inode)->lli_clob;
00911         LASSERT(clob != NULL);
00912 
00913         io = vvp_env_thread_io(env);
00914         io->ci_obj = clob;
00915         io->ci_ignore_layout = 1;
00916         result = cl_io_init(env, io, CIT_MISC, clob);
00917         if (result == 0) {
00918                 page = cl_page_find(env, clob, vmpage->index,
00919                                     vmpage, CPT_CACHEABLE);
00920                 if (!IS_ERR(page)) {
00921                         lu_ref_add(&page->cp_reference, "writepage",
00922                                    current);
00923                         cl_page_assume(env, io, page);
00924                         result = cl_page_flush(env, io, page);
00925                         if (result != 0) {
00926                                 /*
00927                                  * Re-dirty page on error so it retries write,
00928                                  * but not in case when IO has actually
00929                                  * occurred and completed with an error.
00930                                  */
00931                                 if (!PageError(vmpage)) {
00932                                         redirty_page_for_writepage(wbc, vmpage);
00933                                         result = 0;
00934                                         redirtied = true;
00935                                 }
00936                         }
00937                         cl_page_disown(env, io, page);
00938                         unlocked = true;
00939                         lu_ref_del(&page->cp_reference,
00940                                    "writepage", current);
00941                         cl_page_put(env, page);
00942                 } else {
00943                         result = PTR_ERR(page);
00944                 }
00945         }
00946         cl_io_fini(env, io);
00947 
00948         if (redirtied && wbc->sync_mode == WB_SYNC_ALL) {
00949                 loff_t offset = cl_offset(clob, vmpage->index);
00950 
00951                 /* Flush page failed because the extent is being written out.
00952                  * Wait for the write of extent to be finished to avoid
00953                  * breaking kernel which assumes ->writepage should mark
00954                  * PageWriteback or clean the page. */
00955                 result = cl_sync_file_range(inode, offset,
00956                                             offset + PAGE_CACHE_SIZE - 1,
00957                                             CL_FSYNC_LOCAL, 1);
00958                 if (result > 0) {
00959                         /* actually we may have written more than one page.
00960                          * decreasing this page because the caller will count
00961                          * it. */
00962                         wbc->nr_to_write -= result - 1;
00963                         result = 0;
00964                 }
00965         }
00966 
00967         cl_env_nested_put(&nest, env);
00968         GOTO(out, result);
00969 
00970 out:
00971         if (result < 0) {
00972                 if (!lli->lli_async_rc)
00973                         lli->lli_async_rc = result;
00974                 SetPageError(vmpage);
00975                 if (!unlocked)
00976                         unlock_page(vmpage);
00977         }
00978         return result;
00979 }
00980 
00981 int ll_writepages(struct address_space *mapping, struct writeback_control *wbc)
00982 {
00983         struct inode *inode = mapping->host;
00984         struct ll_sb_info *sbi = ll_i2sbi(inode);
00985         loff_t start;
00986         loff_t end;
00987         enum cl_fsync_mode mode;
00988         int range_whole = 0;
00989         int result;
00990         int ignore_layout = 0;
00991         ENTRY;
00992 
00993         if (wbc->range_cyclic) {
00994                 start = mapping->writeback_index << PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
00995                 end = OBD_OBJECT_EOF;
00996         } else {
00997                 start = wbc->range_start;
00998                 end = wbc->range_end;
00999                 if (end == LLONG_MAX) {
01000                         end = OBD_OBJECT_EOF;
01001                         range_whole = start == 0;
01002                 }
01003         }
01004 
01005         mode = CL_FSYNC_NONE;
01006         if (wbc->sync_mode == WB_SYNC_ALL)
01007                 mode = CL_FSYNC_LOCAL;
01008 
01009         if (sbi->ll_umounting)
01010                 /* if the mountpoint is being umounted, all pages have to be
01011                  * evicted to avoid hitting LBUG when truncate_inode_pages()
01012                  * is called later on. */
01013                 ignore_layout = 1;
01014 
01015         if (ll_i2info(inode)->lli_clob == NULL)
01016                 RETURN(0);
01017 
01018         result = cl_sync_file_range(inode, start, end, mode, ignore_layout);
01019         if (result > 0) {
01020                 wbc->nr_to_write -= result;
01021                 result = 0;
01022          }
01023 
01024         if (wbc->range_cyclic || (range_whole && wbc->nr_to_write > 0)) {
01025                 if (end == OBD_OBJECT_EOF)
01026                         mapping->writeback_index = 0;
01027                 else
01028                         mapping->writeback_index = (end >> PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT) +1;
01029         }
01030         RETURN(result);
01031 }
01032 
01033 struct ll_cl_context *ll_cl_find(struct file *file)
01034 {
01035         struct ll_file_data *fd = LUSTRE_FPRIVATE(file);
01036         struct ll_cl_context *lcc;
01037         struct ll_cl_context *found = NULL;
01038 
01039         read_lock(&fd->fd_lock);
01040         list_for_each_entry(lcc, &fd->fd_lccs, lcc_list) {
01041                 if (lcc->lcc_cookie == current) {
01042                         found = lcc;
01043                         break;
01044                 }
01045         }
01046         read_unlock(&fd->fd_lock);
01047 
01048         return found;
01049 }
01050 
01051 void ll_cl_add(struct file *file, const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_io *io)
01052 {
01053         struct ll_file_data *fd = LUSTRE_FPRIVATE(file);
01054         struct ll_cl_context *lcc = &ll_env_info(env)->lti_io_ctx;
01055 
01056         memset(lcc, 0, sizeof(*lcc));
01057         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&lcc->lcc_list);
01058         lcc->lcc_cookie = current;
01059         lcc->lcc_env = env;
01060         lcc->lcc_io = io;
01061 
01062         write_lock(&fd->fd_lock);
01063         list_add(&lcc->lcc_list, &fd->fd_lccs);
01064         write_unlock(&fd->fd_lock);
01065 }
01066 
01067 void ll_cl_remove(struct file *file, const struct lu_env *env)
01068 {
01069         struct ll_file_data *fd = LUSTRE_FPRIVATE(file);
01070         struct ll_cl_context *lcc = &ll_env_info(env)->lti_io_ctx;
01071 
01072         write_lock(&fd->fd_lock);
01073         list_del_init(&lcc->lcc_list);
01074         write_unlock(&fd->fd_lock);
01075 }
01076 
01077 static int ll_io_read_page(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_io *io,
01078                            struct cl_page *page)
01079 {
01080         struct inode              *inode  = vvp_object_inode(page->cp_obj);
01081         struct ll_sb_info         *sbi    = ll_i2sbi(inode);
01082         struct ll_file_data       *fd     = vvp_env_io(env)->vui_fd;
01083         struct ll_readahead_state *ras    = &fd->fd_ras;
01084         struct cl_2queue          *queue  = &io->ci_queue;
01085         struct vvp_page           *vpg;
01086         int                        rc = 0;
01087         bool                       uptodate;
01088         ENTRY;
01089 
01090         vpg = cl2vvp_page(cl_object_page_slice(page->cp_obj, page));
01091         uptodate = vpg->vpg_defer_uptodate;
01092 
01093         if (sbi->ll_ra_info.ra_max_pages_per_file > 0 &&
01094             sbi->ll_ra_info.ra_max_pages > 0) {
01095                 struct vvp_io *vio = vvp_env_io(env);
01096                 enum ras_update_flags flags = 0;
01097 
01098                 if (uptodate)
01099                         flags |= LL_RAS_HIT;
01100                 if (!vio->vui_ra_valid)
01101                         flags |= LL_RAS_MMAP;
01102                 ras_update(sbi, inode, ras, vvp_index(vpg), flags);
01103         }
01104 
01105         cl_2queue_init(queue);
01106         if (uptodate) {
01107                 vpg->vpg_ra_used = 1;
01108                 cl_page_export(env, page, 1);
01109                 cl_page_disown(env, io, page);
01110         } else {
01111                 cl_2queue_add(queue, page);
01112         }
01113 
01114         if (sbi->ll_ra_info.ra_max_pages_per_file > 0 &&
01115             sbi->ll_ra_info.ra_max_pages > 0) {
01116                 int rc2;
01117 
01118                 rc2 = ll_readahead(env, io, &queue->c2_qin, ras,
01119                                    uptodate);
01120                 CDEBUG(D_READA, DFID "%d pages read ahead at %lu\n",
01121                        PFID(ll_inode2fid(inode)), rc2, vvp_index(vpg));
01122         }
01123 
01124         if (queue->c2_qin.pl_nr > 0)
01125                 rc = cl_io_submit_rw(env, io, CRT_READ, queue);
01126 
01127         /*
01128          * Unlock unsent pages in case of error.
01129          */
01130         cl_page_list_disown(env, io, &queue->c2_qin);
01131         cl_2queue_fini(env, queue);
01132 
01133         RETURN(rc);
01134 }
01135 
01136 int ll_readpage(struct file *file, struct page *vmpage)
01137 {
01138         struct inode *inode = file->f_path.dentry->d_inode;
01139         struct cl_object *clob = ll_i2info(inode)->lli_clob;
01140         struct ll_cl_context *lcc;
01141         const struct lu_env  *env;
01142         struct cl_io   *io;
01143         struct cl_page *page;
01144         int result;
01145         ENTRY;
01146 
01147         lcc = ll_cl_find(file);
01148         if (lcc == NULL) {
01149                 unlock_page(vmpage);
01150                 RETURN(-EIO);
01151         }
01152 
01153         env = lcc->lcc_env;
01154         io  = lcc->lcc_io;
01155         LASSERT(io != NULL);
01156         LASSERT(io->ci_state == CIS_IO_GOING);
01157         page = cl_page_find(env, clob, vmpage->index, vmpage, CPT_CACHEABLE);
01158         if (!IS_ERR(page)) {
01159                 LASSERT(page->cp_type == CPT_CACHEABLE);
01160                 if (likely(!PageUptodate(vmpage))) {
01161                         cl_page_assume(env, io, page);
01162                         result = ll_io_read_page(env, io, page);
01163                 } else {
01164                         /* Page from a non-object file. */
01165                         unlock_page(vmpage);
01166                         result = 0;
01167                 }
01168                 cl_page_put(env, page);
01169         } else {
01170                 unlock_page(vmpage);
01171                 result = PTR_ERR(page);
01172         }
01173         RETURN(result);
01174 }
01175 
01176 int ll_page_sync_io(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_io *io,
01177                     struct cl_page *page, enum cl_req_type crt)
01178 {
01179         struct cl_2queue  *queue;
01180         int result;
01181 
01182         LASSERT(io->ci_type == CIT_READ || io->ci_type == CIT_WRITE);
01183 
01184         queue = &io->ci_queue;
01185         cl_2queue_init_page(queue, page);
01186 
01187         result = cl_io_submit_sync(env, io, crt, queue, 0);
01188         LASSERT(cl_page_is_owned(page, io));
01189 
01190         if (crt == CRT_READ)
01191                 /*
01192                  * in CRT_WRITE case page is left locked even in case of
01193                  * error.
01194                  */
01195                 cl_page_list_disown(env, io, &queue->c2_qin);
01196         cl_2queue_fini(env, queue);
01197 
01198         return result;
01199 }
